intro: Leysera tenella, commonly known as the slender leysera, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers during the spring and summer months. Leysera tenella is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
